books.title: Monolith to Microservices: Evolutionary Patterns to Transform Your Monolith
books.description: How do you detangle a monolithic system and migrate it to a microservice architecture? How do you do it while maintaining business-as-usual?
books.author: Sam Newman

books.title: Building Microservices: Designing Fine-Grained Systems
books.description: As organizations shift from monolithic applications to smaller, self-contained microservices, distributed systems have become more fine-grained.
books.author: Sam Newman

books.title: Microservices Patterns: With examples in Java
books.description: Microservices Patterns teaches you 44 reusable patterns to reliably develop and deploy production-quality microservices-based applications.
books.author: Chris Richardson

books.title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications: The Big Ideas Behind Reliable, Scalable, and Maintainable Systems
books.description: Data is at the center of many challenges in system design today. Difficult issues need to be figured out, such as scalability, consistency, reliability, efficiency, and maintainability.
books.author: Martin Kleppmann

books.title: Java Message Service: Creating Distributed Enterprise Applications
books.description: Java Message Service, Second Edition, is a thorough introduction to the standard API that supports 'messaging' the software-to-software exchange of crucial data among network computers.
books.author: Mark Richards

books.title: Fundamentals of Software Architecture: An Engineering Approach
books.description: Salary surveys worldwide regularly place software architect in the top 10 best jobs, yet no real guide exists to help developers become architects.
books.author: Mark Richards

books.title: Software Architecture: The Hard Parts
books.description: There are no easy decisions in software architecture.
books.author: Neal Ford

books.title: Programming TypeScript: Making Your JavaScript Applications Scale
books.description: Any programmer working with a dynamically typed language will tell you how hard it is to scale to more lines of code and more engineers.
books.author: Boris Cherny

books.title: Effective TypeScript: 62 Specific Ways to Improve Your TypeScript
books.description: TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript with the potential to solve many of the headaches for which JavaScript is famous.
books.author: Dan Vanderkam

books.title: JavaScript: The Definitive Guide: Master the World's Most-Used Programming Language
books.description: JavaScript is the programming language of the web and is used by more software developers today than any other programming language.
books.author: David Flanagan
